lines.text:
[looking at his son]
Hey! No propeller.
John, uh, he's a jet plane.

[crying out in despair]
*A JET*! JETS! JETS! I CAN'T STAND JETS!
[repeated lines]
Mary.
John.

[as John lines up with the jets at the contest, she arrives on the scene and begs him not to do it]
John! Listen to me, John!
[as she's doing this, Junior gets out of the buggy and gets into the fuselage of John]
Listen to me, John!
[John shoves her away defiantly, then we cut to her looking into the empty buggy]
Junior?
[She looks over at John to see Junior smiling and waving from his cockpit]

[In horror]
JUNIOR!
[first lines]

[seeing a depressed John land in the hangar]
Any luck today, John?
No, Mary, same as yesterday. I went to every airport in town, and they just don't have any use for an old, burned-out B-29.
Nonsense.
[she and John kiss]
You can fly as well as any of those newfangled airplanes. Did you tell them of your wonderful war record?
[John looks at a portrait of himself as a proud, well-decorated war plane]
A hero of ninety missions over the Pacific?
Yeah. I even showed them my purple heart.
[suddenly upset]
But all they want nowadays is jets, jets, jets!
Now, now, John, watch your oil pressure.
